findings.title: Malicious NFT which is not transferring the asset can still get payment
findings.description: A malicious ERC721 or ERC1155 token with a modified transfer method can simply not transfer the NFT and still receive payment.

findings.title: Successful erc20 transfers can sometime revert
findings.description: In the `TransferProxy` contract, the method `erc20safeTransferFrom` always validates the return value to make sure the assets are transferred. Though this will work fine for most tokens, some ERC20 implementations do not return a value and instead throw on failures.

findings.title: Use of dependencies with known security vulnerabilities in build system
findings.description: The dependency tree of the build and test system in the project shows 23 known vulnerabilities, out of which 11 are considered high severity. These could lead to accidental key exposure during deployment.

findings.title: Cancel function is susceptible to front-running
findings.description: The cancel method in the marketplace contract is susceptible to front running. An order that is meant to be canceled can be positioned right before the cancel message in the block to execute the order.

findings.title: Use of floating pragma
findings.description: Using a floating pragma version allows any Solidity compiler sub-version to be used, which can lead to compilation with the latest version and potential introduction of recently fixed important compiler bugs.
